content:
Add a Select Input Element to a FlexCard 

Add a Select Input element on a FlexCard to enable users to select an item from a dropdown list. From the Properties panel, configure properties and custom attributes, add an action, and add conditions.

From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Select element onto the canvas.
Configure properties common to all Input elements:
In Field Binding, bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field.
In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element.
Check Required if the user must enter or select a value for this input element.
Check Read-only to disable the ability to modify the input values.

To enter the options from which the user can select, click + Add New in the Options section. Configure the following properties:
Label: Enter the visible label for the option.
Value: Enter the value of the option.
To configure additional properties available to the element, click + Add New in the Custom Attributes section.

To execute an action when a user interacts with the input element, click + Add Action.
(Optional) To add conditions that must be met for the element to display, see Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.
(Optional) To style your element, click Style.
title: Adding Select Input Element to FlexCard
